Class DateTimeTriplet

java.lang.Object
org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.datetime.DateTimeTriplet
Direct Known Subclasses:
LinkedDateTimeTripletMap.LinkedTriplet
public class DateTimeTriplet extends Object
This class is used to represent the date-time types as a triplet of parts, which could be displayed in three separate columns with natural chronological order. This is just a simple wrapper over standard LocalDateTime from JDK.
For a date-time that could be received from terminal in following way 
    ...> date -u
    Wed Oct 15 06:03:38 UTC 2025
the properties of this class will be:
methodvalue
getYearAndMonth()"2025-10"
getDayOfMonthAndWeek()"15 (Wed)"
getHoursMinutes()"06:03"
dumpNoWeek()"2025-10-15 06:03"
dump()"2025-10-15 (Wed) 06:03"
As far as git-repository provides the commit-time in UTC time-zone - this class also represents all it's parts for UTC time-zone and day of week corresponds to Locale.US (Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun) by default .

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static Supplier<Locale>
    DAY_OF_WEEK__LOCALE
    The default names of days of the week correspond to English USA locale (Locale.US)
    static Supplier<TextStyle>
    DAY_OF_WEEK__TEXT_STYLE
    The default format of the day of the week is English USA three letters (like Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun)
    static Supplier<Instant>
    NOW_PROVIDER
    This provider could be helpful in unit-tests that allows to avoid an unnecessary mocking

      public String getYearAndMonth()
      Returns:

    • getDayOfMoth

      public int getDayOfMoth()
      Returns:
      an ordinal number of day within the month (from 1 to 31)

    • getDayOfWeek

      public DayOfWeek getDayOfWeek()
      Returns:
      a day of week as enumartion DayOfWeek

    • getDayOfMonthAndWeek

      public String getDayOfMonthAndWeek()
      Returns:
      the second part of date-time triplet that contains getDayOfMoth() the day of month} and the day of week as 3-letters acronym in a format described in the declaration of DateTimeTriplet

    • getHours

      public int getHours()
      Returns:
      a value of hours in the half-open range [0..24)

    • getMinutes

      public int getMinutes()
      Returns:
      a value of minutes in the half-open range [0..60)

    • getHoursMinutes

      public String getHoursMinutes()
      Returns:
      the third part of date-time triplet that contains colon':'-separated hours and minutes

    • dump

      public String dump()
      Returns:
      concatenation of 3 parts: 
      yearAndMonth'-'dayOfMonthAndWeek' 'hoursMinutes

    • dumpNoWeek

      public String dumpNoWeek()
      Returns:
      the same as dump(), but without day of week:
      yearAndMonth'-'dayOfMonth' 'hoursMinutes
